Conspiracy to Commit Soliciting a Child for Prostitution

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receive Compensation for Human Trafficking [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.302(2)(c).
  • Receive Compensation for Human Trafficking, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.302(2)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Applicable fees, assessments, Court costs and surcharges including a DNA assessment. You may  have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid  as a condition of the Extended Supervision.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under Sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
-The court does not order a DV surcharge.
Concurrent with: Credit for 433 days. *1/25/2017  credit amended to 367 days.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant does not have to register as a sex offender.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

-The Court rejects probation recommendation.

Original Transcript (48 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 04-27-2016 received and filed.

Defendant Anthony L Powell in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Defendant Anthony L Powell in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS CONCURRENT, with credit for 433 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS CONCURRENT, the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
THE COURT REJECTS PROBATION RECOMMEDATION.
The Court does not order a DV Surcharge.  The defendant does not have to register as a sex offender.
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

THE COURT REINSTATES THE DEFENDANTS TELEPHONE, MAIL AND VISITS.

Parties appeared via telephone. Defendant was in custody and produced.
Case calendared for 3.3.16 court was in trial and unable to call this case before 5pm.  Due to the court being in trial this case was spun to Judge Wagner.  Attorney Webb was to appear for the sentencing and was at a hearing in another county and would not have arrived in time to have the case heard before Judge Wagner.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Filed by the state:  CHART; Crime Victim Impact Statements(2)

Defendant Anthony L Powell in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Defendant Anthony L Powell in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Amended Information received and filed AMENDING  ALL THREE COUNTS TO TWO COUNTS.
AS TO COUNT 1: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Receive Compensation for Human Trafficking PTAC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.302(2)(C), 939.05 a Class F Felony.
AS TO COUNT 2: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Receive Compensation for Human Trafficking, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.302(2)(C), a Class F Felony.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Earlean Antonia Laster in court, defendant Anthony L Powell not in court, in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Webb appeared before case was called. Defense requests an adjournment for further negotiations. Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE FINAL PRETRIAL AND SPEEDY JURY TRIAL IN BRANCH 7.

Defendant Anthony L Powell in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster and attorney Robert E Webb Jr.  Defendant Anthony L Powell in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties newly appoint. Requesting an adjournment of the Jury Trial set for 01-11-2016. Have not received all discovery. No objecton from the State. Court grant request. Court will VACATE Jury Trial. A SPEEDY JURY TRIAL DEMAND entered into the record.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Diane Rose Caspari in court, defendant Anthony L Powell not in court, in custody.  Karl Hayes for Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COURT IS IN TRIAL. ADA Karshen is in trial in another court.   Attorney Caspari moves to withdraw as counsel due to the defendant retaining private counsel. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the court. Attorney Caspari would like the court to correct the 6.26.15 record as it should state that she did not agree to an adjournment per the transcript. Court is not in receipt of a transcript and needs to review. Clerk checked ccap for proof of trancript filing. Clerk noted that the transcript was filed on 12.3.15 at 12:21 pm in the Clerk of Court's Office.  Attorney Caspari turned over a folder of discovery to the clerk.  Attorney Laster appeared after the case was called and was notified of what took place. Clerk provided Attorney Laster with a discovery folder left by prior counsel.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony L Powell in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Anthony L Powell in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense has not received discovery or an offer from the State. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court ordered case set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Court ordered State to turn over discovery by 3/30/2015. Parties to file motions by 4/10/2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. If deadline to turnover discovery is not met, Court ordered State to notify defense counsel in writing as to what discovery is outstanding and why. Case adjourned to branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony L Powell in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Anthony L Powell in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defense moves to dismiss all counts for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
